ADDITIONAL METRICS INFORMATION

1. - 4. Stormwater Management BMP Type(s) and area(s): This is the list of the various BMPs used to treat a single site and their corresponding area of each BMP in square feet.

5. Project Development Type: The two choices are: "New Development" and "Re-development".

6. Site Reduction Classification: These can be either Runoff Reduction (RR) or Stormwater Treatment (ST) practice types.

7. Impervious area draining to BMP (sf): The impervious area contributing runoff to the bioretention area with units in square feet.

8. Area draining to the BMP (DA, sf): The total drainage area contributing runoff to the bioretention area with units in square feet.

9. Runoff volume captured (EP, acre-ft): This is the total runoff volume stored in the bioretention area as calculated by the state-specific Engineering Parameter (EP) in acre-feet (CSN, 2015).

10. Runoff depth Treated (RT, inches): This is the depth of runoff captured and treated by the BMP in inches, as calculated by the formula RT = EP*12/(IA/43560), as described in CSN (2015).

11. USWG Adjustor Curve Efficiencies (%): These are the CBP USWG efficiencies calculated for either RR or ST as a function of RT (CSN, 2013b).

12. No. of observed bird or small animal species: As your stormwater management area matures, count the number of bird and other animal species that begin to populate the area Sellner et al., 2012, pp.160-161.

13. Adaptive management checks: Summary Field Sheet (above); CSN, 2013a; CSN, 2014; Sellner et al., 2012.

REFERENCES

CSN. 2013a. Bioretention Illustrated: A Visual Guide for Constructing, Inspecting, Maintaining and Verifying the Bioretention Practice. CSN Technical Bulletin No. 10. Available at: http://chesapeakestormwater.net/wp-content/uploads/downloads/2013/10/FINAL-VERSION-BIORETENTION-ILLUSTRATED-102113.pdf.

CSN. 2013b. Frequently asked questions (FAQ) for recently approved Urban BMPs. September 9, 2013 Memorandum to the Urban Stormwater Workgroup.

CSN. 2014. Stormwater BMP and LID Maintenance: A Guide to Proper Maintenance Practices for Local Government Staff and Landscapers. Chesapeake Stomwater Network video. Available at: http://chesapeakestormwater.net/training-library/design-adaptations/stormwater-bmp-maintenance/.

CSN. 2015. Recommendations of the Expert Panel to define Removal Rates for New State Stormwater Performance Standards. Revised January 20, 2015. Prepared for the CB Urban Stormwater Workgroup. Available at: http://www.chesapeakebay.net/documents/Final-CBP-Approved-Expert-Panel-Report-on-Stormwater-Performance-Standards-LONG_012015.pdf. Accessed: 30 April 2015.

Sellner, K.G., M. Palmer, L. Wainger, A.P. Davis, B. Benham, E.J. Ling, and G. Yagow. 2012. Metrics and protocols for progress assessment in Chesapeake Bay Stewardship Fund Grants. Final Report to the National Fish and Wildlife Foundation. CRC Publ. No. 12-174, Edgewater, MD. pgs. 41-43, 142-146, 160-161. Available at: http://www.nfwf.org/chesapeake/Documents/Metrics%20and%20Protocol%20Report.pdf.

VDCR. 2013. Virginia DCR Stormwater Design Specification No. 9 Bioretention. Version 2.0. January 1, 2013. 59 pages. Available at: http://chesapeakestormwater.net/2012/03/design-specification-no-9-bioretention/.
